Articles.Content:
Mods, if you'd be so kind, let this sit for a day, before you fire it out of the rockomax engine to where posts of this nature usually belong.

Just wanted to take a minute to explain some things. I've been gone a while, as you all know. Taking care of sick parent, working et cetera. ADHD pans in a bit. And I've been dabbling here and there and everywhere. But I've got a much more recent and welcome distraction!

I had a brunch with a person I've taken a shining to from the office. A pretty lady I figure would have no interesting in the surly, hirsute codger you see before you. It went rather well. And now, just maybe an hour ago, I've confirmed that the next meetup with be an actual date. WOOOO!

For a span of time, I get to enjoy being the luckiest person in the world! I'm so happy! Pardon me for getting a little of my celebration on you.

And with that, I return you to the rapid unplanned disassembly almost assuredly in progress.

*whirls madly away*

Edited February 18, 2015 by Whackjob
Congrads on a new found love. Hope it lasts for many, many, many wonderfoul years.

You and me both, brother. I've been mostly locked in the house, taking care of said sick parent. I've had no social or love life in more than ten years.

And just that quick, when I least expected it, I get to again rejoin the human race. This planet is awesome!
Congratz WhackJob ! I hope your relationship will always remain stable and joyful !

*squeeee*

Grats Whackjob and nice to see you show up again. Would this be the right moment to build a whackjovian valentine day contest entry?
This post has been in General Discussion for far more than a single Standard Galactic Day, and as such has promptly been moved to the Space Lounge, where it belongs.
*shakes fist halfheartedly* I'm too happy to be truly irate.

If only she (I hope it's not a disguised he) doesn't come to understand where you truly sit on the Cosmic Scale of Randiness.

Or, if she does, that she might rate higher than you, somehow.
Given she has two children from a previous marriage, I don't think I have to wonder so much in that regard.
yop whack long time no sea ; )
Three days have elapsed. I am still giddy.
Delightful news. I am dabbling in dating again myself. Good for you, Sir Whackjob.

The best part is I spent a long time trying to work up the nerve to ask her out. And SHE asked ME out! I spent the whole day wondering if some deity had found the universal console and figured out one of the cheat codes.

If only she (I hope it's not a disguised he)

It's time to stop posting.

Congratulations, Whack. Here's to a good relationship between the two of you.
Life is colorful when someone is in love. Its feelings cannot be compared with anything else. Good luck!

I've got another Whack-ism for yas. I figured I'd better post this one. She said at one point that she was concerned that maybe she was carrying some baggage. This was my response.

"Everyone has baggage. Sometimes it's brightly colored and has tons of those little destination stickers all over it, so everybody can't help but look and see where it's been. Sometimes it's camo and lumpy and uninteresting and nobody sees it. But we all carry some. The trick is to remember to extend that little handle and to drag it on the wheels. You might have to carry it with you, but the key is to not let it weigh you down."

"Everyone has baggage. Sometimes it's brightly colored and has tons of those little destination stickers all over it, so everybody can't help but look and see where it's been. Sometimes it's camo and lumpy and uninteresting and nobody sees it. But we all carry some. The trick is to remember to extend that little handle and to drag it on the wheels. You might have to carry it with you, but the key is to not let it weigh you down."

"You must spread some Reputation around before giving it to Whackjob again."
Congrats, Whackjob! I'm too young to really know what it feels like to have a girlfriend, but I'm glad for you nevertheless!
she doesn't happen to wear an orange suit and have green skin, now?

Congrats, I hope you find that you're a perfect match

try not to spend your dates talking about KSP.

Edited February 22, 2015 by MartGonzo
spelling

Congrats, I hope you find that you're a perfect match

try not to spend your dates talking about KSP.

I will, actually. She's a gamer, too, though she's got a Mac and not a PC. I'm already considering building her a proper gaming rig.

Even though my budget is largely shot, I might pick up a temporary second job. Though I also have a promotion looming, which may solve that for me.

I will, actually. She's a gamer, too, though she's got a Mac and not a PC. I'm already considering building her a proper gaming rig.

Even though my budget is largely shot, I might pick up a temporary second job. Though I also have a promotion looming, which may solve that for me.

And what's wrong with gaming on a Mac? Granted, mine is a crap rig, but some are very nice. Though I consider myself a PC person.

Build her a heart-shaped space station, and launch it in one go!

I will, actually. She's a gamer, too, though she's got a Mac and not a PC. I'm already considering building her a proper gaming rig.

Even though my budget is largely shot, I might pick up a temporary second job. Though I also have a promotion looming, which may solve that for me.

That's perfect, so cool that she has some similar interests.

As for a second job, have you ever considered becoming an evil genius?

You seem to have the necessary whacky doomsday device skills and it pays well I believe

I will, actually. She's a gamer, too, though she's got a Mac and not a PC. I'm already considering building her a proper gaming rig.

Even though my budget is largely shot, I might pick up a temporary second job. Though I also have a promotion looming, which may solve that for me.

If it's a more recent mac with a decent cpu, gpu, ssd, minimum 8 GB of RAM, and a modern set of I/O, it should work just as well if not better than a PC when you install windows through bootcamp.

congratulation on your new girlfriend and your looming promotion!

And welcome back!
